text: Dawn on the field, cold grass on our shoes Silk in our hands, a cathedral of hues Fan wakes the fabric, burners bloom gold We’re lighter than stories we used to be told Knots off the crown line, shadows grow thin A breath and a bright flare, we teach the air to lift us in The town is a circuit, a soft neon grid We rise through the math of it, silent, vivid Hold, read the flag, feel edges of light Lean into patience, let altitude write Parallax opening, worries go small When you’re above it, you can see it all We lift—on neon thermals, slow and true Over the algorithm of streets we knew painter with altitude’s brush Vent for a whisper, the basket hush Thermals like data, we choose what to ride it Sometimes we guide it, mostly decide Which layer to follow, which layer to leave sunsets, vocoder blue Perspective is mercy when it carries you From the ground they hope, and up here we find We’re small, not lesser - just differently aligned Flame to a cinder, fabric a sigh Boots on the meadow, a low amber sky We touch back to earth with the sky in our chest Seeing more clearly makes gravity kind, and rest
